segments.text: I see the water pouring out of the sink, and it’s making me so frustrated.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying dishes like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the children reaching for cookies, and it’s like they don’t even care about the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is standing on that stool, and it’s just asking for trouble.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman should really turn off the faucet before the whole kitchen is ruined.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting for a cookie, not even noticing the water everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if anyone is going to do something about this before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is a disaster, and it’s making me so upset.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm the woman looks while everything is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just spreading everywhere, and it’s making me so anxious.
segments.speaker: PAR
